Dan spent $ 11.76 on a snake toy , and a cage cost him $ 14.54 . Dan also found a dollar bill on the ground . What was the total cost of Dan 's purchases ?
output: Dan spent $11.76 on the snake toy and $14.54 on the cage. He also found a dollar bill on the ground. The total cost of his purchases was $11.76 + $14.54 + $1 = $27.30. The answer is $27.30.

instruction: A car company produced 3884 cars in North America and 2871 cars in Europe . How many cars is that in all ?
output: The car company produced 3884 cars in North America and 2871 cars in Europe. In total, they produced 3884 + 2871 = 6755 cars. The answer is 6755.

instruction: There are 9 crayons in the drawer . Benny placed 3 crayons in the drawer . How many crayons are now there in total ?
output: There were 9 crayons in the drawer. Benny placed 3 more crayons in the drawer. So now there are 9 + 3 = 12 crayons in total. The answer is 12.

instruction: There are 139 erasers and 118 scissors in the drawer . Jason placed 131 erasers in the drawer . How many erasers are now there in total ?
output: There were 139 erasers and 118 scissors in the drawer. Jason placed 131 erasers in the drawer. So now there are 139 + 131 = 270 erasers in the drawer. The answer is 270.

instruction: Ellen made smoothies in the blender . She used 0.2 cup of strawberries , 0.1 cup of yogurt , and 0.2 cup of orange juice . How many cups of ingredients did Ellen use for the smoothies ?
output: Ellen used 0.2 cup of strawberries, 0.1 cup of yogurt, and 0.2 cup of orange juice. The total amount of ingredients she used is 0.2 + 0.1 + 0.2 = 0.5 cups. The answer is 0.5 cups.

instruction: Greg and Sharon own neighboring cornfields . Greg harvested 0.4 acre of corn on Monday and Sharon harvested 0.1 acre . How many more acres did Greg harvest than Sharon ?
output: Greg harvested 0.4 acre of corn and Sharon harvested 0.1 acre. The difference between the two is 0.4 - 0.1 = 0.3 acre. Greg harvested 0.3 acre more than Sharon. The answer is 0.3 acre.

instruction: Sally has 9 orange balloons and 4 blue balloons . She lost 2 of the orange balloons . How many orange balloons does Sally have now ?
output: Sally had 9 orange balloons and 4 blue balloons. She lost 2 of the orange balloons. Now she has 9 - 2 = 7 orange balloons. The answer is 7.

instruction: Melanie had 19 dimes in her bank . Her dad gave her 39 dimes and her mother gave her 25 dimes . How many dimes does Melanie have now ?
output: Melanie had 19 dimes in her bank. Her dad gave her 39 dimes, so after that she has 19 + 39 = 58 dimes. Her mother gave her 25 dimes, so in total she has 58 + 25 = 83 dimes. The answer is 83.

instruction: There are 115 pencils in the drawer . Sara placed 100 pencils in the drawer . How many pencils are now there in all ?
output: There were 115 pencils in the drawer. Sara placed 100 pencils in the drawer. Now there are 115 + 100 = 215 pencils in the drawer. The answer is 215.

instruction: There are 112 short trees and 119 tall trees currently in the park . Park workers will plant 105 short trees today . How many short trees will the park have when the workers are finished ?
output: There are 112 short trees and 119 tall trees in the park. The workers will plant 105 short trees today. After they are done, there will be 112 + 105 = 217 short trees. The answer is 217.

instruction: Keith picked 3 pears and Jason picked 2 pears from the pear tree . Joan picked 5 apples from the apple tree . How many pears were picked in total ?
output: Keith picked 3 pears and Jason picked 2 pears. That means in total 3 + 2 = 5 pears were picked. Joan picked 5 apples, but that does not affect the number of pears picked. The answer is 5.

instruction: There are 39 dogwood trees currently in the park . Park workers will plant 41 dogwood trees today and 20 dogwood trees tomorrow . How many dogwood trees will the park have when the workers are finished ?
output: There are 39 dogwood trees in the park. Today they will plant 41 trees, so after that there will be 39 + 41 = 80 trees. Tomorrow they will plant 20 more, so in total there will be 80 + 20 = 100 trees. The answer is 100.

instruction: Last year at Newberg 's airport , 14507 passengers landed on time . Unfortunately , 213 passengers landed late . In all , how many passengers landed in Newberg last year ?
output: There were 14507 passengers who landed on time and 213 passengers who landed late. In total, there were 14507 + 213 = 14720 passengers who landed in Newberg last year. The answer is 14720.

instruction: A waitress put leftover tarts into the fridge on Thursday night . instruction: Sally had 39 baseball cards , and 9 were torn . Sara bought 24 of Sally 's baseball cards . How many baseball cards does Sally have now ?
output: Sally had 39 baseball cards. 9 were torn, so she had 39 - 9 = 30 cards. Sara bought 24 of Sally's cards, so now Sally has 30 - 24 = 6 cards. The answer is 6.

instruction: The Silvergrove Public Library used a grant to purchase 2647 books . Now the library has a total of 8582 books . How many books did the library have before the grant ?
output: The library had 8582 books after the grant. Before the grant, they had 8582 - 2647 = 5935 books. The answer is 5935.

instruction: A restaurant served 4 pies during lunch and 9 during dinner today . The restaurant served 7 pies and 2 pizzas yesterday . How many pies were served in total ?
output: The restaurant served 4 pies during lunch and 9 pies during dinner today. Yesterday they served 7 pies and 2 pizzas. In total, they served 4 + 9 + 7 = 20 pies. The answer is 20.

instruction: There are 2 pencils in the drawer . Tim placed 3 pencils in the drawer . How many pencils are now there in total ?

instruction: Joan found 6 seashells and Jessica found 8 seashells on the beach . How many seashells did they find together ?

instruction: There were 28 bales of hay in the barn . Tim stacked bales in the barn today . There are now 54 bales of hay in the barn . How many bales did he store in the barn ?

instruction: Fred went to 36 basketball games this year , but missed 35 . He went to 11 games last year . How many basketball games did Fred go to in total ?

instruction: Mary is baking a cake . The recipe calls for 7 cups of flour and 3 cups of sugar . She already put in 2 cups of flour . How many cups of flour does she need to add ?
